basics.name: Qingyuan Yu
basics.label: Mathematics-Computer Science Student
basics.summary: Mathematics-Computer Science student at UCSD with a strong background in programming, data analysis, and financial modeling.

work.name: SIC Middle School Student Investment Challenge
work.summary: Conducted a comprehensive investment analysis on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), utilizing financial modeling and risk assessment strategies.
highlights: Won the Global Silver Award in the International Student Investment Challenge.
Performed financial performance analysis and market trend evaluations.
Utilized DCF Analysis and Comparative Company Analysis to form investment strategies.

work.name: Columbia University Summer School
work.summary: Completed an intensive data analysis program focusing on data processing, statistical analysis, and data visualization.
highlights: Completed projects involving real-world data sets.
Made data-driven decision-making recommendations based on data pattern interpretation.

awards.title: Provost Honors
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding academic performance in multiple quarters.

awards.title: Global Silver Award
awards.awarder: SIC Middle School Student Investment Challenge
awards.summary: Recognized for excellence in investment analysis and financial modeling.

projects.summary: Ongoing specialization course focused on developing expertise in data structures and algorithms.
